name: SCOR SPACE-SHIELD Techniques
description: ESA SPACE-SHIELD Techniques adapted to SCOR namespace, structured in matrix format.

values.description: Adversary actively scans RF or optical space communication links to identify potential entry points or weaknesses.
Collection of mission-specific data to support targeting of spacecraft or ground systems.
Identify personnel, organizational structure, and affiliations relevant to the mission.
Collect proximity-based information by maneuvering close to a spacecraft or monitoring orbital parameters.
Listen passively to communications without active probing.
Obtain sensitive information via social engineering and phishing campaigns.
Acquire or build infrastructure to support operations.
Compromise user accounts to support further actions.
Compromise third-party infrastructure to stage operations.
Develop custom tooling or obtain relevant capabilities to execute attacks.

values.value: Direct Attack to Space Communication Links
values.description: Exploit uplinks or downlinks to gain initial access.
Compromise ground segment infrastructure to control spacecraft or intercept data.
Compromise spacecraft payload or components pre-launch.
Exploit trusted partner or vendor relationship to gain access.
Use of compromised valid accounts to access systems.

values.value: Modification of On Board Control Procedure
values.description: Modify onboard control procedures to execute adversary commands.
Leverage native APIs to execute unauthorized actions.
Execute payload commands for malicious objectives.
Install backdoors to maintain access.
Manipulate key management infrastructure to maintain control.
Persistence achieved through boot-level modification.
Re-use of valid credentials for long-term access.
Gain elevated control by becoming bus master on avionics systems.
Escape from containerized or isolated execution environments to host system.
Escalation via boot-level modification.
Disable or impair onboard defenses.
Remove indicators of compromise on host.
Masquerade malicious activity as legitimate processes or commands.
Evade defenses by tampering with boot processes.
Intercept and manipulate communications between ground and space segments.
Use brute force methods to obtain credentials.
Sniff links for credentials or tokens.
Retrieve telemetry, tracking & control keys to unlock access.
Discover how key management is implemented.
Identify onboard components to map potential attack surfaces.
Identify services available on ground or onboard systems.
Identify trusted links and partnerships between operators.

values.value: Compromise of another partition in Time and Space Partitioning OS or other types of satellite hypervisors
values.description: Move laterally by compromising a neighboring partition or virtualized environment.

values.value: Compromise the satellite platform starting from a compromised payload
values.description: Use a compromised payload as a pivot to gain control of the platform.
Move laterally across satellite or ground segments via relay mechanisms.

values.value: Payload takeover after compromising the main satellite platform
values.description: Take over payload systems after gaining control of the main platform.
Intercept data flows for collection and exploitation.
Collect data by eavesdropping on RF or optical links.
